3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 17 septembre 2017
So here's the thing: I love walkingsimulators. Storyrich games are my jam. HOWEVER cheap walkingsimulators literally make me so nauseaus I have to quit or deeply in- and exhale every 5 seconds to avoid puking (and not the cute kind, if there even is such a thing as cute vomiting). Now in a good WS I am stubborn as ♥♥♥ and get through it by sucking it up because it's worth it. But this particular game (you guessed it) is utter crap. Not only does it give me one of the worst gaming nausea I've ever had, but it also pressures me to rush through it because else I'd freeze to death. Hello, it's a WALKING simulator. It's supposed to give you time to enjoy and get sucked into the story by fully exploring it.
I still wouldn't mind so much if the story I got from the diary entries or the "scenic" cuts would be worth it. But once again, it ain't! It's nothing more than two adorable because Irish accents reading some story about the IRA which I'm not too involved with because I'm neither Irish, nor politically involved.

Maybe the story and gameplay is lost on me, because I'm ignorant. It obviously has good reviews. But maaaaybe it's just a cheap game trying to make money off a historically relevant event without making the effort in presenting it accordingly.

In summary: If I wanted to puke by spending 10 bucks, I would've bought a copy of DJ Khaled's Sex Tape.
 
LizMie
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2018
Man what a game...

A very interesting story, where an Irish man and his wife are flying away from home in a search to start anew. They end up crash landing on a mysterious island and they're seperated from each other; You play as the husband and have to survive the harsh snowy environment and try to reach your wife before she freezes to death.

This game is obviously a "Walking Simulator" but it does have a tid bit of puzzle solving in there. There's also some pages you have to find to figure out the back story of the main character from his wife's point of view, which is really the only way to get a sense of the whole story being told. Graphically, the game is superb and surprisingly well optimized; I was able to run it at a steady 60 on the highest settings with a few drops to 50-55 FPS towards the end (Which is excusable due to so much happening on screen).

All in all; This game is so worth it for it's $10 asking price. It's short but man, there is so much story told for such a short amount of time to play.

10/10 Game

Edit: The soundtrack too! It's very good and it's also free! Makes certain moments in-game feel very, realistic, I guess? It allows you to feel what the character would feel i guess. Very good though!
 
CrispyOmega

Walking around, that is what you do the most in this type of game, is completely boring and insignificant.

It has a pro though: it's so short that I can ask for a refund.

2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 février 2018
This game has absolutely nothing, although the graphics and voice acting were at least decent.

There is zero challenge. There are no puzzles and no interaction, except "turn every valve you find on your way". It's 100% linear, carefully guiding you from step to step, no deviation from the predetermined path is possible. Like being stuck in an endless corridor with some occational dialog playing in the background. Yet the story is rather lame, unbelievable, and confusing, and it's almost completely told through written notes you find long the path. And that's it, really. Yes, yes, I know all about walking simulators. I typically like them. But in this one you walk without purpose.

Évaluation publiée le 7 septembre 2017
Straightforward walking simulator with no obstacles whatsoever. You pretty much walk from one fireplace to the other and find some items to progress to next area, the only "challange" is that you may die because of cold if you don't find a fireplace in time.
Story/music/etc are not interesting either, there are nice places here and there, but mostly it's an annoying walking simulator where nothing happens.

Finally the reason why I actually decided to give a negative review is the fact that last achievement requires you to collect all missing pages. I probably missed one, but can't see myself replaying this boring game just to find it. There must be some indicator or option to replay levels where you missed pages, not the full story.

And the price is higher than should be.
 
BlackSoul
1,677 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 aout 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

THE FIDELIO INCIDENT

PUBLISHER – Act3 Games, LLC
DEVELOPER – Act3 Games, LLC
GENRE Walking simulator/adventure, Indie

THE BASICS:
A Walking Simulator set on a below-freezing island, with some minor adventure elements. You're the only living creature you ever encounter (save for some stinging jellyfish that just stay put in order to keep you on the path) is yourself. Immersive atmosphere – grand music, solid voice acting, and even the snow/wind/etc effects contribute to the feel of the game.

THE FLOW AND THE STORY:
You (Stanley) and your dear love, Leonore, are flying in a small plane when they suddenly crash on a deserted, frigid island. They're both on the run from their past, and now your wife is trapped in the plane's wreckage up on the top of a nearby mountain; her diary was taken by the four winds, and spread out all across the isle. You need to stay alive – often running from a steam vent to a flaming bit of wreckage, or vice versa, just to stave off the deadly cold for a few more seconds. Crank open steam vents to create a safe space, and seek out Leonore's diary entries so that you can both get off of the island alive, and with no-one else the wiser.

CONTROLS:
Controller or WASD (controller recommended by the devs). Simple, straightforward, streamlined controls. No inventory to bother with; items you find are needed pretty much immediately and used automatically. The game tracks diary entries in the pause menu, and there's nothing else to worry about. E to grab items, left-shift to “sprint” (the effects of which range from decent down to almost unnoticeable, depending on the local terrain, aside from blurring your vision a bit).

GRAPHICS:
Grand vistas and attention to detail – even if they are of ice, snow, and half-frozen bunkers for much of the game. Some parts feel same-y quickly, but that just drives your need to move quickly and get to a new, warm area in order to survive. That being said, the environs are convincing and well-executed. Even if there's a whole lot of white-on-white.

SOUND:
Absolutely gorgeous. The game's plot was inspired by Beethoven's opera “Fidelio,” and the music in the game does not disappoint. The soundtrack is free with purchase of the game, and is more than worth listening to on its own. Your boots crunch scrumptiously in the snow, flames crackle with life, and rusty levers groan as you force them to do their jobs.

OVERALL:
Short but good. 2 hours if you rush, 1 and a half if you take your time or just can't quite make it to the next safe spot. That being said, yeah, it's worth fifteen bucks for an experience that makes you think (you'll understand when you reach the end credits), and the inclusion of the OST for no extra charge makes the price more than fair. After all, how may $50-60 games have you played with only 4 or 5 hours of gameplay needed to beat them?

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:
Mid-range. Core i3 2ghz+, 6 GB RAM, Win 7+ 64bit

REVIEW BY: Eric_Kei

STORY: 80
GAMEPLAY: 90
GRAPHICS: 85
SOUND: 100
FUN FACTOR: 85
ATMOSPHERE: 100

Pros:
Creepy in its own way, but in a very subtle way
Immersive environment
No enemies per se in the game, save for the environment itself
Amazing soundtrack and audio effects

♥♥♥♥:
Quite Short
Visuals (while pretty) for 70% of the game are of snow, ice, snow and ice, or half-frozen underground bunkers

Previously published on dlh.net -- Eric_Kei
 
Eric_Kei

I paid 99¢ for The Fidelio Incident yesterday and got about three hours of entertainment in return, so I can't complain. The story was okay, though the protagonist's monologues were a little clumsy at times. There were certain things that didn't make a lot of sense, like why all the steam vents, and why didn't they boil my skin off when I walked through them? Minor complaint, though. For the money, it was worth my time.

Évaluation publiée le 28 mai 2017
Some similarities to Dear Esther, especially the end, but much more in the way of game mechanics/puzzles. Quite unique in that it deals with the conflict in Ireland, and kudos to the devs for not delaying the game, unlike some others in the industry...overall it is a walking sim, and not even a long one, but does have some interesting puzzles and very palpable environments - cold, hot, etc. Some very nice visuals and excellent voice acting. Recommended if you like this type of thing.

Évaluation publiée le 5 aout 2017
A compelling narrative propels you through the icy cold Icelandic tundra. With charming and endearing voice acting, The Fidelio Incident is a unique experience that tackles the social and political turbelance of the Irish Troubles of the late 20th Century.

An excellent "walking sim" that is both thought-provoking and emotionally captivating.

Read my full review here: https://www.keengamer.com/article/16796_the-fidelio-incident-review

Évaluation publiée le 24 mai 2017
The Fidelio Incident

- no FOV slider / basic controls - its a walking simulator ( no crouch ) / problems with the mouse disappearing in menu when alt+tab used / 21:9 support present ( at least 2560x1080 works ) !
- there is a "cold" mechanic ( you have to warm up in specific places ) !
- you cant see your feet - and you dont leave footprints ( this breaks immersion ) !
- optimisation could use some work !
- personally i love unreal engine games / great - presentation of the documents , music and voice acting !
- at this price i sure recommend the game !

NOTE : Chromatic Aberration is enabled by deafault which will ruin the experience for the majority of players !

1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
4.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 27 juin 2018
Good thing I got this game on the summer sale for less than an euro, if not, I would already ask for a refund. I thought I was in for a nice adventurous tale of survival, but what I got out instead, wasn't what I was expecting the least.

Pros:

- Starts off interesting, like a normal story about survival would
- The graphics are gorgeous
- Visual atmosphere is good
- The music is powerful
- Stanley's voice acting is good
- It's short, about 2 hours (I have more hours because of afk)

♥♥♥♥:

- Soon you realize It is not fun to play, I mean at all. The gameplay in general feels tedious and dull, and did I mention boring? Basically, you find a number of paths, you soon find out only one path is open to progress, paths gets blocked on the way by ridiculous and silly excuses just for you to do something to clear the path and progress... And there are levers to switch too, plenty of them. The game is too limited in terms of realism, besides the visual setting, and the freezing mechanics, it has none.

- Soon even the story becomes absurd and changes the feel of the game completely
- Eleanore's voice acting and accent are terrible to listen to
- Collecting notes of her diary is a cheap way of telling a story and it's, again, not fun
- If I read/listened to Eleanore narrating a page in the cold, after the reading I would be frozen and soon dead. That made me skip the notes at some points. And at this point I didn't care about the story anymore, anyway.
- Often after reading a note and exiting the diary page screen, would make Stanley move sideways uncontrollably for a period of time like 15 seconds, definitely a bug.
- Lots of invisible walls and only linear paths
- Super slow walking and running, sometimes the walking becomes even slower by design
- Puzzles are easy but most of them tedious as well, felt completely unnecessary. A good tale of survival shouldn't have these kinds of arcade puzzles.

In conclusion this game felt like mess... I enjoyed it the first 15 minutes and this was it. Good thing it's so short, cause it already felt way too long. And yeah, nedless to say, I do not recommend this game.
 
abysss24
1,407 produits enregistrés
0
3 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 juillet 2017
Really nicely put together story driven game here. It's easy to beat, a pleasure to endure and has some really on the edge of your seat moments. Linear & short; a little overpriced at £11 IMHO but otherwise very good indeed.

Gameplay:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-Al6rzTlW-gUuUJIWMdSmlm7xL_XLBGz

After you crash land in the ice covered and frozen tundra you will become more than closely acquainted with the icy waters, snow caped hills, mountains, bugs, stench, memories, the maze and hailstones! All these experiences and challenges are nothing more than obstacles to overcome in order to save your wife from this icy hell.

There is an underlying storyline here which I won't spoil for you but the journey is an ultimately enjoyable one, a little spooky at times but ultimately it shouldn't take you too long to figure out where you’re going and from where you have come.

Contains a few nice shocking moments, a few freaky weird ones and ultimately thought provoking and solemn self-reflection is almost unavoidable.

Certainly looking forward to the next story, I just hope it can increase in length, difficulty and complexity as I think each of those three aspects could perhaps be ramped up a bit. Overall thoroughly enjoyed every moment.

dilhandoit
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 décembre 2018
I can't figure out whether I'm sick of games where <spoiler>you end up dead or sacrificing yourself for the greater good at the end and everything you encounter is a clue to your comatose state</spoiler> or if this game's story actually just sucks. I would normally be all over a game about the Troubles but I didn't care for the way this was executed, and once I figured out what was really going on, it was tough to stay connected to the protagonist.

The graphics are good, puzzles are logical and easy, and I thought the voice acting was okay. But boy howdy, was I bored with whatever dreary things were happening in the story. It's all so formulaic (see above spoiler for why) and I couldn't get into it. Give me a dang polar bear or something to break up the monotony, or more corpses to scare the bejesus out of me. (There is one corpse to find and it is underwhelming.)

The last twenty minutes in particular dragged on, and I rolled my eyes every time I encountered another valve to turn on and off. Then the actual ending was a letdown (again, see spoiler.) There are a couple Artifex Mundi games that this reminded me of, and even though those games are less dynamic and don't allow controller use I found myself wishing I was playing them instead.

This game is pretty cheap right now, which is why I got it, and I'm glad I didn't spend more. I'm recommending it (again, why doesn't Steam have any middle ground options for rating?) but with the caveat that you should definitely buy it on sale. I finished it and it kept me interested for the first half of the game so I'm not going to give it a thumbs down, but if I'm rating 1-5 I give it a 2.5.
 
s47474
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 avril 2018
Produit reçu gratuitement

This game was bought for me by a friend, so I feel I have the ability to remain impartial for once. Which is good, because I really, really like this game. It throws you right in with the plane crash at the beginning, walks you around a desolate landscape for the entire game, and then drops a bombshell in the sense that you didn't survive most of the game and died at the beginning from frostbite, which you understand as you see the hypothermia signs more and more throughout as he exhibits those symptoms. Nevertheless, it still tells a good story about a man with links to the IRA, and how it clearly affects his judgement. The only down mark for me about this game, is that in one playthrough I collected all of the collectibles using a guide to be sure, only to get to the end of the game and not get the achievement, menaing at some point I have to go thorugh the entire game again for no reason for the 100%. Otherwhise, would definitely recommend 9/10

Start to finish about 2.2 game hours of play. Bought the game on sale through Steam and in my opinion it was worth the price. While I was not happy with the ending I believe it was the correct path for the developer to take. The reason is clear in the end why this choice was made. I am lacking one achievement at this point since I missed one of the pages required. I will revisit the game to find the last one at some point. It was nice not having to fight some crazy "boss" or something to complete the levels / game. Overall a solid piece of work and well worth the sale price at least.
 
=SDZ= Drifter
524 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 aout 2022
This was a really great walking simulator! There are puzzles, so not quite sure it's *strictly* a walking sim, but they are so simple they shouldn't give anyone trouble. I finished it my first playthrough in under 2 hours, so it's a perfect length for a rainy afternoon and doesn't overstay its welcome, something I always appreciate.

The story was deeper than expected, the scenery was interesting to traverse through, the voice acting was pretty good, and the conclusion was bittersweet yet satisfying. The devs should be proud of this one! Check it out, especially if it's on sale. The game is really good, but 10 bucks is slightly high for a 90 minute experience. Worth it, though! I suppose a blu-ray is like 20 bucks, so this is a better deal IMO.

Watch some Lumps Plays on YouTubes.

5 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juin 2017
First of all, I do love a good walking simulator. I did enjoy Firewatch. But this game I can only describe as dull, uneventful, boring and utterly forgetful.

You might not agree, and maybe I didn't understand all of it, but I couldn't even read all the diary pages because they were sooooo booooring, gosh.

We play walking simulators for two reasons: scenery and story. This game got neither (60% of the game is in the basement). The mazes were terrible. The ending twist was obvious.

And the Irish accent didn't help. I dunno, if you're Irish you've probably liked it.

Non recommandé
1.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 16 aout 2017
*RECOMMENDATION ONLY MADE WHEN ON SALE*

Full review here -
Vidéo YouTube™: The Fidelio Incident - Review 
Vues : 1,335
Steam group - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/hihugames


The Fidelio Incident plays with a lot of common video game motifs. I finished it and well yeah... I finished it. Nothing about my time with this game stood out as being enjoyable or bad as it was so middle of the road. It does everything I have done with a video game, and does it again. Not to say that is a bad thing, I didn't dislike my time with this game. There genuinely were some moments I liked. But at the end of the day, I found myself when the credits were rolling saying 'eh'

The story was eh
The gameplay was eh (has mild survival aspects)
The graphics were okay
The writing was eh

Can only recommend when on sale.
 
Seaniemaurice
736 produits enregistrés
4
2 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 février 2018
I'm just posting this to counter all of the whiny "it's a story game" negative reviews. Yeah, you're paying $10 (I got it on sale for $3) for a two-hour story-driven game. Would you pay $10 for a movie ticket? You get the same bang for the buck as that, only with the added bonus of getting to replay it whenever you want. There's a deep secondary narrative hidden away in the collectibles and me and my gf theorized an entirely different alternate ending before we found out the real one thanks to this added narrative depth. It's a fun story and, though the game has a kind of slow start, it picks up quick, leading to a fun, light-puzzle-filled adventure that's sure to leave your jaw on the floor by the time the credits roll.
 
Human Required
345 produits enregistrés
0
25 personnes ont trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 mai 2017
Vidéo YouTube™: The Fidelio Incident - Brought to us by the God of War Art Director 
Vues : 287
The game is stunning, has a lot of talent behind it and I am loving it. A lot of this video is just me marvelling at the game. You should definitely pick it up.

Beautiful. Stunning. Intricate.
Well-crafted melodies flow over the background of an amazing frozen landscape.
Gameplay is intuitive.
The stakes are effectively raised several times in the first 30 minutes, each one compelling the player to the next pillar of smoke, the next fire or the next journal entry.
Emotional voice acting has you buying into the story immediately.
Highly reccommended.

Évaluation publiée le 5 juin 2017
Produit reçu gratuitement

Geforce GTX 1060 Gameplay:
Vidéo YouTube™: 👀➦ A Quick Look @ The Fidelio Incident | GTX 1060 | (GIVEAWAY ENDED!) 
Vues : 123
GIVEAWAY ENDED! I HAVE 3 STEAM KEYS TO GIVEAWAY. COMPETITION DETAILS IN THE VIDEO! MY 'QUICK LOOK @' SERIES FEATURES UP TO THE 1ST HOUR OF THE GAME. THERE IS NO COMMENTARY.


My Thoughts:
I love to be pleasently surprised and this game is stunning. The attention to detail surpasses many a AAA title. The graphics, environment and effects are breathtaking. The story and dialogue is so intriging it pushes you forward wanting to discover more. You can tell a lot of passion and incredible work has gone into this. If you like games like 'Firewatch' then this game deserves to be in your collection. it's a must. Even now, writing my thoughts I can't get this game out of my head.....

Game Details:
The Fidelio Incident is a single-player, first-person thriller set off the coast of Iceland. Inspired by Beethoven's only opera Fidelio. After a violent plane crash, Stanley must search a desolate frozen island in search of his wife Leonore while covering up any traces of their identity.

A really great story. Very short though, so consider it more like buying a ticket to an interactive film. Visuals are great as well, and there's not much for gameplay. But the story is really what makes this one so good, and it's what you'd be buying it for.
 
ScarfKat
737 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 aout 2022
This game is very much for me what a walking simulator should be. It should take you on a journey and have a strong narrative but still give you some puzzle's to solve and game play.
I think it's an underrated hidden gem and should definitely be given the attention it deserves.

One of the reasons I took so long to play it - and perhaps a suggested feature update - would be that if you pick up a diary entry you have to wait for the audio to finish because if you put it back in your pocket the audio stops. So I knew if I wanted the full experience I would have to be willing to wait or read it myself. I think if you had the option to keep playing the audio in the background I'd honestly have replayed the diary pages over and over - the voice acting is so brilliant.

I don't think I can say I loved the game because can you love a war movie? I'm not sure...
Was it awesome,magnificent, breathtaking and heart-moving ? Absolutely.
It was an experience I hadn't have in a long time with a game (if ever?) like an unputdownable novel. Where you have to keep going to know what happened. And I think one of the reasons is definitely the voice acting.
The way I would have kept playing this game until the end as if I personally knew both of them - that is just a masterful story.

It's games like these that makes me want to start a blog just for gaming reviews.
 
MidnightHallow
272 produits enregistrés
1
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 15 aout 2022
Seeing somebody claiming this had bad voice acting is absolutely hilarious as it is the strongest aspect of a generally very enjoyable game. Excellent performances backed by a good soundtrack.

The game as such has little gameplay, but tells a great story of psychological and physical trauma. It is not flawless by any means, but for a previously bundled game you can get for a lot cheaper than the MSRP of 10 bucks it is completely worth your time - especially if you are into freezing survival.
 
Unfussable
1,062 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 aout 2022
This game is pretty much what you can expect from a good walking simulator. As a plane crash survivor you'll be exploring buatiful scenery of a small northern island and - no surprise here - surreal visions your character will experience during his journey. Along the way you will solve some simple environment puzzles and will get an idea about your character's story through pages of his wife's diary scttered around. Nothing groud breaking, but what you get here is done exceptionally well. If you're a fan of walking sims, you shouldn't miss that title.

possibly the worst walking simulator i have ever played. normally i hate the term walking simulator as it is belittling, but here it is fitting for what is presented, except you have to press shift a lot, so it's practically a "running while breathing heavily and shivering simulator". neither the monotonous, boring game play nor the pretentious, lame story is good enough to keep you going. puzzles are non-existent. you just get to come across some stuff and you have solved that "puzzle" to progress. this thing is really crappy, quit halfway through, stay clear.

Évaluation publiée le 22 mai 2022
I bought this game, hoping for a fun walking simulator, maybe a bit of puzzles, y'know. It looked promising. But if the first thing I have to do is to turn off the narration of the snippets of diary that you keep finding, it's not a good start. The freezing mechanic is annoying and tedious at best and adds nothing to the story. Puzzles are either not very intuitive or could not be more spelled-out and in your face. All in all I really, really would not recommend this game. It's no fun. Don't waste your time.

2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 1 mai 2022
Is it worth the $10-$15 it is normally priced at? No. Is it worth the sale price? Absolutely. It is mostly a pure walking simulator with the most basic of puzzles (in fact I think all the puzzles are linear so I'm not sure they are even really puzzles). The story is nice though and it's essentially like playing through a movie. Worth the few hours it takes to play but probably forgettable in the long run, but the sales price make it worth it.
 
insider
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2022
Dear Esther 'Lucky Charms' edition.

It at least has survival mechanics, but is just as slow and, as a bonus (depending on your preferences, of course) lacks purple prose, which makes the whole complaining of a titular female sidekick about "muh daddy issues", her husband, toxic masculinity and overall "me, me, me - woe is me in such unfair world of the privileged" through her diary pages even more obnoxious.

Very middling recommendation. The environments are nice, but the pace is snail-crawlingly slow and 'some' characters are tiring in their self-centered, almost narcissistic obsession with themselves, while the others are deliberately written as complete tools just to serve the story of redemption.
 
matrixdll
2,402 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
0.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 janvier 2022
I would like to recommend this game or even give a fair non recommendation but at present I can't play it! I have a pretty competent gaming laptop with an i7 and an nvidia 3060 yet I can't get more than about 20 seconds through the game on any graphics setting without it crashing at about the same spot, and there don't seem to be any resources online on what might be causing this. I've tried a lot of different possible fixes and benchmarked my own pc to make sure it is working properly and by all accounts it should be. It seems the game has some strange bugs when it comes to certain configurations. I won't be refunding the game as I hope the devs will be able to fix this strange issue but for others I'd beware.

Evil Steve
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 janvier 2022
This is actually a good thriller walking simulator game with decent price. It has interesting story, gorgeous graphics, and simple mechanics. Although the game is a little bit messy here and there, here are the problems I've encountered in 2 hours of playtime:
1. Sometimes the game won't launch at all, only black screen will appear.
2. Sometimes alt tabbing won't work.
3. My game was ridiculously dark in the "prison" part. I couldn't see anything except the lights even with my monitor brightness maxed out, this is not supposed to happen since you need to see something in order to progress, probably making a patch would fix this.

Overall, would give this 6/10. It's still quite a buggy mess.
 
Hermestaff

Some pretty strong thematic elements here, but ultimately let down by a hugely predictable twist, a subject that has been thoroughly explored in more effective media, and the fiddle-de-dee potatoes my lucky charms accents.

Also it punishes you for walking around exploring, despite that being a defining genre characteristic. Why?

The real incident is this game: a walking sim with a twist hitting a roguelike dying cold between fires, both crashing into a pipe and valve puzzle game. Unexpected yet welcome.
Decent story though, nicely narrated while surviving a well depicted icy landscape. The irish accent made me miss a bunch of passages. Short but intense, still really worth it.

From Dear Esther to Dear Leonore.

Évaluation publiée le 30 décembre 2021
THE FIDELIO INCIDENT

A Amazing story driven narrated walking Simulator based on a very interesting story and ending.

I really can't say anything besides the music, scenery and effects are outstanding.

Any details on the story will ruin the experience which can be finished fully in 2 hours.

But.. I will tell you about hypothermia..

First you will experience shivering, frostbite
Then confusion and Hallucinating
After that a strong feeling of burning alive
Lastly, death.

8/10
 
Heinsy57
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 décembre 2021
I really, really, really wanted to like this game, and I tried playing it multiple times. But it's just not a good game.

First, the whole idea of random fires and random pipes with valves to open to keep you warm is patently ridiculous. There is a concept called "suspension of disbelief" which is a fancy way of saying you know something isn't realistic or reasonable but you go along with it because the story is so good or the execution is so good that you can ignore the problems and contradictions. A good example are the Marvel movies. We all know that a person cannot fall 50 feet onto a solid steel walkway and then just hop up with a minor grunt. We all know he'd at least have to break a couple bones. But when Captain America grunts and gets up we go with it because the Marvel movies are so well done. This game is DEFINITELY not in that class. The whole time its absurdities are in your face.

Next, the graphics are mediocre even though they used the Unreal 4 engine. If I didn't know, I would've guessed Unreal 3 or an older version of the Unity engine. The graphics are NOT this game's strong points.

Next, the drama in the story can only be appreciated if you're over a certain age. Specifically, the history of Ireland and England. I'm 55 years old, so I remember the violence, bloodshed and death that came out of Ireland's fight for independence from England. And I remember how monumental it was when a truce was negotiated during Bill Clinton's and Tony Blair's time in office. If I played this game without that knowledge, I'd be totally bored and quite confused as to what this game was referring to.

Finally, the puzzles, such as they are, are annoying, not challenging. Due to the mechanic of you must periodically get to a fire or a steam fissure (which conveniently are scattered about the entire game world), it's just damn frustrating trying to explore and gather the information necessary to solve the puzzles. The puzzles are mainly obstacles to your progress which are solved by searching, finding clues (mainly diary pages) and deducing the solution to get around the obstacles. I understand the game mechanic of imminent death from freezing was supposed to add tension and drama, but it doesn't. It's just annoying.

Do not waste your hard-earned money on this game, at any price.
 
craig.russell535
98 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
0.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 décembre 2021
Tentative recommend.
I got stuck during the first flashback.
A few things really irked me.
  • Surely "Leonore" is two syllables, not three! Reminds me of Donald Pleasance and the Pumaman. I guess they're using the German pronunciation because the whole thing is a Beethoven reference?
  • step #1 after a crash is to activate your EPIRB[en.wikipedia.org]. They don't even lampshade this. This is really bad! Don't train gamers to ignore the EPIRB!
  • if you fall into freezing water, you're pretty much ♥♥♥♥♥♥. You don't just stand next to a fire for ten seconds. You need to change into dry clothes. You definitely don't jump back into the water 2 or 3 more times.
  • He's stung by walking over jellies. What, his boots fell off during the crash?
  • The plane looked like an unpressurized model (something like a DC-3), so both of them should be rugged up for cold weather already, because it's bloody cold at 30,000 feet. Did his clothes fall off during the crash?
  • On the phone, there's an interference pattern "doot doo-doo doot doo-doo doot" that is characteristic of what an FM radio receiver emits when it's close to a 2G phone that's receiving an incoming call. He doesn't have an FM radio. Why is it doing that?
  • The phone works at all. This is Heligoland or something. There's no cell towers. They had two satphones on the plane?

Évaluation publiée le 17 octobre 2021
look at the end of this review if you have issues with the game

The game is quite short. About 2 hours, but I played it twice. I highly recommend it, and if you do buy it, take your time with it, and I think you absolutely SHOULD play it twice, possibly finding all the pages the second time you play. The graphics and audio are great. The story was quite ok for me when I played it for the first time, but became much more after the second playthrough. STILL - not perfect, not very good, but decent. It is a well-made game for what it is. It also doesn't feel like a "walking simulator" that much. Yes... very nice game, if you see it on sale go and get it.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 7 aout 2021
Many of the puzzles are a bit ham-fisted, and rarely take much time/effort to solve. So if this were solely an adventure/puzzle game without much plot, I'd give it a thumbs down.

However, taken as the walking simulator The Fidelio Incident is meant to be, I can't say I have much else to complain about. The diary entries you collect are well polished (not just the writing, but lots of nice art as well), and have solid voice acting to back them. The game's controls and mechanics are intuitive and serve their purpose. Most important for this type of game of course, is the story, which I found engaging and competently told, even if it wasn't anything too groundbreaking. Walking through The Fidelio Incident introduced me to characters, showed me their experiences and how they felt in response, and watching them feel things made me feel things. It's hard to ask much more than that of a story-driven game, so The Fidelio Incident deserves a thumbs up in my book.
 
P = NP /BBQPRTY\
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 octobre 2021
This game is actually pretty amazing. It does many things right, although it does have some flaws, which I believe are preventing more people from truly appreciating this as an experience that's not that distant from gems like Firewatch. I'll start with the good stuff:
- Gorgeous and varied scenery, that's beautiful to look at, all the way. It's also very well optimized: even though it looks incredible, and I had everything on ultra, it still didn't make my laptop heat up too much.
- Amazing voice acting, that makes the story come alive. Also, pretty nice soundtrack.
- Well fleshed-out characters and amazing scenes that illustrate what they go through and went through. Some animations are amazing, and really get you to feel what the character is feeling (especially when you have to climb walls: the combination of visuals and sound make you really feel how difficult it must have been).
- Relevant story, that even if you are not familiar with what happened in Ireland (I wasn't), will still get you invested, and is easy enough to understand (everything comes together at the end). It's not the least bit pretentious, like some titles on this kind of game can be (Dear Esther, I'm looking at you). Everything is very well depicted, especially a nightmare scene that really makes you feel what the character is feeling; it's amazingly done.
- A very interesting set of mechanics, that either require you to solve some pretty standard puzzles, or manage a character variable (coldness) in a realistic way. This can bother some players who were looking for a purely contemplative experience, but it adds a layer of realism that it would have lacked if it hadn't been done this way, and can be greatly appreciated by people who like more game-play elements than just walking.

The problems with the game are far fewer, and can be managed relatively easily, at least in the current state of the game (I've read about people losing progress, but it didn't happen to me, even when I quit to desktop and reloaded the game many times over during my playthrough):
- If you are using a TV as a monitor, this game suffers from a problem a few other games also have (the ones I've encountered were point and click though, and I think they weren't made in Unreal Engine, so I don't know what the connection is): when starting the game, the screen stays black (it can either have sound or not), and never loads. The fix is the same as for those other games: you have to change sound device so that you use your PC speakers. This completely solves the problem.
- I had one instance of the game not loading after reaching the menu. Force-quitting the game and starting it again fixed it.
- The game autosaves, and while I didn't have much of a problem with that (it was mostly easy to tell where that would happen), it doesn't have chapter select, and if you want to go back anywhere, you need to restart the game. This is a gameplay problem that would have been easy to fix, but wasn't. I think it would have made a difference for some of the people who disliked it.
- Following from the previous one, if you want to go for all of the achievements, you need to find the 30 letters scattered around the game. They are mostly easy to find (especially if you are used to exploration games), but I missed 2 of them right at the beginning of the game, because I didn't catch on quick enough that you had to check everywhere where there's a fire burning (I may have gone there and missed the letters too, you have to actively look for some them to see them). After you finish the game, the letters you collected show up on the menu, but it's only the ones you've found on the playthrough you have finished. If you restart and get the ones you are missing, you still have to finish the whole game for them to show up, and you need to do that in order to get the achievement. I wouldn't go through that again just to get those, so I didn't get the achievement. Maybe some day I'll replay it, but for those who absolutely want to 100% it, either make sure you got all of them in your current area before moving on, or be prepared to play it more than once. This could have been avoided by saving the letters regardless of the playthrough you first got them in, and instead awarding the achievement the moment you collect all of them.
- The game takes about 2 hours to complete, on average. That may seem too short for some people (but I got the game at 90% discount, and for that price, it's a total steal).

Since the good stuff overwhelmingly exceeds the bad stuff, I'm definitely recommending this one. Especially if you like exploration games with a great story, you are bound to enjoy this one.
 
fredling192
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

It's a walking sim, but if you are here for the story, it's not going to take as long as you think if you read and listen and enjoy. Recommandé
5.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 18 novembre 2020
An interesting walking simulator with a great soundtrack and stunning photo-realistic visuals. You should better experience as a movie with one or two (rather boring and easy) puzzles, rather than a game.

It's exactly 2 hours long, so you won't get bored learning about the story of the main characters. As a walking simulator, it's nothing ground-breaking but it serves its purpose.

If you are into a game with amazingly beautiful graphics, and interesting story that is conveyed through (the overused mechanic of) journal pages with minor environment interaction, this game is definitely for you.

6/10

Grab it on a heavy discount, since it is quite short.
 
George.jl
3,204 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 octobre 2020
6/10 - Recommended for fans of the genre.
It's a walking simulator, and the game mechanics and challenges are very light. It is possible to die or get lost, but you have to try pretty hard. The game tends to clearly hint what you are supposed to do (e.g. by putting a light source where you should look or having the main character say something). Sometimes the tasks seem a bit redundant, but since its a short game, it isn't too bad.
Most of the game consists of putting together the story behind the situation. Most of this is done by finding small bits and pieces of diaries and such. There is narration, and for a someone with English as a second language, the voice acting sounds convincing, although maybe not brilliant.
The story itself is fairly interesting and touching, and the game is quite good when it comes to atmosphere. The graphics are beautiful and the sound works good. There are some shifts in pace that also works good. The ending may be a little bit "flat", but it's not terrible.
All in all the game is good, but not great. It's short - takes about 2-3 hours to complete. I'd give it 6 out of 10.
 
[DoN] nVader

The best Walking Simulator I've played in a while.
The Fidelio Incident has a thrilling story being told through pick-ups. This way the players understanding of the situation can change at any time but gets clearer as one progresses.
I also enjoyed the beautiful scenery, music and voice acting.

All in all, a great game for people who like walking simulators.

Évaluation publiée le 16 avril 2020
I really liked the atmospherics, the music, the story. The puzzles were kind of not so much fun with a lot of backtracking required to open this and adjust that and go back and repeat the sequence until you get it just right. Kind of a distraction and I lost a lot of time there when I just wanted to get on with the story. I wish there was a white flag button I could throw and the right valve or whatever would just start working. But that's me, I'm an old impatient geek. It was kind of long with some repetitive sequences but overall it was a lot of fun and I tip my hat to the graphic artists and flow designers for all the amazing sets. Except for the cockpit of the turboprop they were in. The instrument display made no sense whatsoever. How hard would it have been to get that accurate? But that's a minor flaw. I would buy more walking simulators from this company!

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2020
First person survival walking sim where you uncover the interesting story through journal pages as you pick your way through the ice covered landscape trying to stay warm. Graphics are gorgeous and BGM and voice-overs are great. The game played without problems except for one. Starting at the monstrous tree, the LMB caused the game to freeze for a moment- about 15 seconds at the most. It fixes itself but its jarring in that it pulls you out of the atmosphere of the game. I was no longer looking for Leonore, instead I was thinking about the error. Fortunately the game provides two ways of interacting with items LMB and E. Once I switched to using E, the problems ceased. Overall great game! Loved it so much, I finished it in one sitting.

Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 10 avril 2020
Pros:
-Graphics are absolutely beautiful
-Puzzles may be a bit repetitive but aren't too difficult and are good if you are looking for a casual game

♥♥♥♥:
-Wasn't very invested in the story. For such a short game (2-ish hours) this is expected but could have been i little more interesting.
-The whole 'needing to find all the journal pages or else' was frustrating. If the driving force towards the delivery of the story is having to read 15+ journal entries during the game then you're going to struggle getting the audience engaged.

Would i recommend this game?
The Fidelio Incident was an interesting dive into the 'Walking Simulator' genre and certainly made for a good casual gaming experience for the 2ish hours playtime. I find the $15AUD base pricetag pretty ridiculous for the content it supplies, however was satisfied with the $1.50AUD i paid for it during a sale.

Recommandé
4.9 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 mars 2020
Leonore , you are my light
It's about love , or , the dilemma some of us may face with.
Love, once mixed with history, begins to become heavy.
The world is not short of good ending, but what we often encounter is a dilemma.
Happy ending is always a happy ending. But there are always thousands of sad endings that make you cry.
The creator's design is so subtle that it makes you feel like you are Stanly. Desperate to save his wife's mood, by the cold weather to shiver shiver, climb up the cliff of the rough breathing are very specific. The sign at the end is just what Stanly came through stage.
The plane hit a flock of birds and crashed on the island. The husband Stanly relied on intermittent signals and black smoke from the ground to find his wife Leonore. The first entry is the ice field, pick up the phone to have a chance to go into the cave, just climb out of the cave soon encountered an earthquake, the ice is difficult to walk. Most of the equipment on the island was old, and the weather was getting colder. Each time I ran to the hot air, I breathed a sigh of relief. The line of sight was almost half a meter away, and there were animal carcasses all over the ground, and I did not know where the road was. The most annoying thing was the suffocating feeling in the basement. The light is too dim, the whole atmosphere is very depressed.
Stanly has nightmares about black and white and prison bars stacked on top of each other on three or four floors, and the drowsy quality of the noise and blurry quality of the old camera. You extremely want to be free but stuck in place. It was nice to see the whole scene lit up by the sunset, though the trees and flying insects would get in the way. From the bottom of the ice to the top of the hill, Stanly could barely breathe. Watching the sunset from the edge of the cliff is probably the most comfortable moment of the game.
Yeah, so what if we get to the top? There's only the wreckage. The door on the staircase next to the wreck opened and there was an endless series of stairs, up, up, up, down, down, down at the last moment. Stanly recalled the incident thirty years ago. His father was an Irish pacifist, but his wife's father was an IRA member serving a life sentence for terrorist activities. How could they be together, with the IRA and the British and Irish governments between them?
Boiling, burning.
Scene suddenly let a person in the sea of fire. some closer way to his wife's road will be blocked by the falling tree. It went back and forth, and there were places that needed to be solved to get through. Stanly managed to reach the wreckage where his wife was, but there was no way out. The only path, sent her husband back to the origin.
 
Sherry Song
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 14 mars 2020
Review Summary
Graphics: 8/10
Story: 8.5/10
Playtime: 6/10, too quick. expected something a little more longer.
Bugs: Never got one
Ease of Control: 9/10
Voice acting: 10/10, LOVE the Irish accent
Price over quality: 7/10, just buy it on discounts.

Overall a pretty well-made game, beautiful graphics, interesting ,sad story and a nice soundtrack. There's no option to turn off motion blur, it made me nauseous after a couple minutes of gameplay, had to take breaks to continue the game.

A short walking simulator game, that plays like a movie about a man coming to terms with his past while reaching her wife that has stranded on an icy island. Lite puzzle work and finding your wife's journal pages.
Looks really good visually and atmospherically.

After playing once I don't have incentive to replay the game to find all the pages I missed.

Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 janvier 2020
An intense story that is told in an interesting fashion. Some not very difficult puzzles need to be solved and it's nice that they are organically integrated into the environment.

The game is a nice example for how one can make a player navigate to key positions without using artificial waypoints or a minimap.

The game running time is a bit on the short side -- most will probably complete it within 2-3 hours -- but I liked the captivating and original story, the graphics and the sound (including the music).

Évaluation publiée le 7 janvier 2020
Very well done, by indie standarts just a top notch. Nice visual effects and work with EU4 (not your usual, basic assets here and there), the pacing, the narration (a pity that most pieces of narration go with notes). Awesome voice work, IMHO.
Needed a bit of tweaking in ini file, to remove CA, Film Grain and Motion Blur effects, there are no options to turn them off.
Also got few dips of FPS here and there, mostly in last, forest area, but it could be my aging CPU and RAM.

WardenCDR
923 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 aout 2019
Its a walking-simulator; there are no enemies to fight or kill, and there are no monsters to run from. The environment is the enemy in this game, though a fairly easy enemy to escape.

The game is short, I completed it in about 2 hours and played it again to get a journal entry I missed so I could get the last steam achievement. But the game isn't TOO short, it felt like it was long enough to have a complete story. The puzzles are simple and don't take much time to figure out allowing you to progress with the story without being held up.

The visuals are very good and the music is also very good. The voice acting is good. The story is good. Really, everything about this game is good. Just play it. How much money do you pay to go see a movie at the theater for an hour or so? This game is like watching a movie you can enjoy for about the same price.

Some other reviewers complained about bugs - I never had a single issue with bugs or glitches. The game isn't exactly relaxing due to the nature and content of the story, but the experience is a good one with resolution at the end. As Shia LaBeouf said, "JUST DO IT."

A simple but atmospheric walking sim that tells an interesting story. The environments are beautiful and well made, often transitioning in surreal and dream-like ways. There are some basic puzzles and you can finish the game in 2h. The setting is a bit jarring, especially when the main part of the story takes place in a completely different environment. I'm not sure it was a good choice, it kinda seems like 2 games smashed into one. Still, I'd recommend the game to anyone interested in a good narrative. 3/5

Non recommandé
3.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 8 mai 2019
This game is a huge disappointment. It's got a good story, great graphics- and literally never, ever works. It's so glitchy it's unbearable. You have no inventory, the soundtrack becomes incredibly grating the seventh time around, and the lagging is extraordinary. Doors won't open, the menu is unusable, the flashlight never turns on. You wonder in circles for hours only to discover the thing you were looking for had simply been glitching out of existence the entire time. Even on the lowest resolution with the lowest graphics, on different laptops and game stations- I don't think it has ever worked even moderately for anyone. The frustration and the misery caused by all of these problems make it simply unplayable. If you want to play something you can really sink your teeth into, I recommend something that works. Games are supposed to be playable. Games are supposed to be enjoyable. The only thing enjoyable about the Fidelio incident is the pleasant Irish accents. Unfortunately, due to the poor quality, half of the time you can barely even hear these. Don't waste your money. I bought this on sale for £3.59, and I STILL wish I could send it back.

2.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 9 avril 2019
Bought this during a Steam sale a while back (as did I many other games) and just got around to playing it. I must say that I enjoyed it! I love these short narrative driven walking sims that remind me so much of reading a good short story. They take you out of the world you live in and transport you into the mind and body of someone else. The game play is simple enough that it won't frustrate even the most casual gamer but also isn't unbearably boring. The fact that you need to be next to a heat source or you'll die is also a good way to make you want to keep moving forward.

Overall 8/10 It's worth a play through

Not too bad of a game, simple puzzles that even a blunt-toting fool like me can figure out.
My Mum's Irish, she's from the south, not northern like these voice actors, but for some reason I didn't find the accents very authentic. Not so much the man's, but the women's voice annoyed me somewhat. Anyway, those are just petty critiques that do not spoil the game in anyway.
The story is interesting enough, especially if you're clued up on the IRA and the past troubles of Ireland.
There wasn't any amazing plot twists or major shockers at the end of the game but for the few pence that this cost me in the winter sale I definitely got my money's worth. If I had the choice of buying a big bar of chocolate of buying this game, I'd chose the game.
I'm low key salty because I got 13/14 achievements but I'm too darn lazy to replay it to find the missing journal pages that I overlooked! :P

0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.2 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 29 décembre 2018
I personally like most the start game rather then the mid-ending sequences.
That's because it's filled by misteries and discoveries, the plot is unfolding at the right pace and the snow/glacial visuals are really great. I rarely take screens in game, but this title made me want to stop and take snapshots! The hypotermia theme is also rendered well, you could hear the wind blowing and feel your eyes searching for a shelter. That's great.
I was, on the other end, much less impressed with the sense of danger caused by fire. It's just a wall-like element, of course you're not trying to walk through it, and it never manage to convey a sense of urgency and desperation.
I would recommend the game for a discounted price, it boost your hopes with the starting environment, but fails to sustain the thrill till the end.
 
EvilSmile
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2018
I really enjoy narrative 'walking simulator' games and this has been my favorite so far. The artwork is beautiful, the music is great, voice acting good, story interesting and the puzzles are good-but-not-ridiculous.
It's not long (took me 3 hours, would have been less but I got pretty lost at one point) but for me, that's a good thing. I wanted to be able to play through a solid story in one sitting. Perfect for a Friday night when you feel like a vegetable in need of entertainment. The part where I got lost is the only bit that wasn't intuitive for me - which isn't something I come across that often, I guess because Friday night vegetables aren't very intuitive. I was able to find my way again with a quick google.
I bought the game on sale and that is what enticed me to 'take a chance' on it (after playing, and being thoroughly disappointed by, Ethan Carter) but I would say that the standard price is worth it for me anyway.
 
steppy
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.7 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 26 novembre 2018
This game deserves the "walking simulator" tag. Make sure you know what that means before you get this game, or you might feel very cheated. These games have super super simple mechanics, and don't really engage a viewer the way a traditional "video game" does. I'm sure many people would argue that it isn't really a video game at all. Think of this as more like a slightly interactive movie than a game.

This game is short, simple, but manages to build attachment to the characters through backstory. It's a little hard to understand what's happening at times, but if you haven't figured it out by the end, it becomes pretty obvious in the credits. So I'm sure some would consider it a small twist in the story, or perhaps some mild mystery.

There's some symbolic ties to Beethoven's opera, but as while I am a music lover, I suspect a person would need a formal education in music (or at least advanced knowledge of classical music) to really appreciate it. I'm afraid it didn't do anything for me.

Overall, I thought the game was ok. To be fair, I almost always am disappointed in "walking simulators," so I suppose it would be equally accurate to say this was one of the best I've played. I was happy picking it up $2.00, but full price seems too high.

maximelesage
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 novembre 2018
Short (sub-3 hour) story-rich walking simulator that contains some puzzle elements. I bought it on a whim months ago and forgot about it until today. Installed it and played through in one-setting. If I had ever known anything about the plot, I had forgotten which made the narrative a nice surprise.

The developers say that their inspiration was games like Firewatch and Death Esther--and that comes through loud and clear in the execution.

The only possible "negative" that might put people off is that it is possible to die in game (with no negative consequence). Dying is solely the result of timing and puzzle-solving in limited portions of the game. The puzzles themselves are fairly easy so don't let this dissuade you from buying the game.

The Fidelio Incident is a very enjoyable, short game that hues does a fine job with the story, graphics, and execution. It's a no-brainer if you like the genre.
 
MLV
382 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 novembre 2018
This is a story with a game added on to it, and what a wonderful story it was. You really owe it to yourself to find all of the journal pages laying around, it will add a lot more to the narritive and really fleshes out the characters. Just use the guide posted on Steam to locate all 30 if you don't feel like searching, but honestly none of them are even remotely hidden. You'll find out about what happened in the past as well as the present and towards the end of the game you'll likely figure out what's *really* going on if you've been paying attention.

Despite being a short game the graphics were simply phenominal. Along with the suprub music and voice acting it's like you're really there in Iceland. $10 might be a little steep for some people but just add this to your wish list and wait for a sale, if you value story in a game I promise you wont be disappointed.
 
Mojave

I would definitely recommend this game to people that like walking simulators and people who want a nice quick charming game to play through.

This game gets a 3.5/5 from me, because it is, after all, a walking simulator :P.

Recommandé
3.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 13 aout 2018
The Fidelio Incident is a walking sim with puzzles and a simple survival mechanic. It has a great story which made me emotional. So far I might have played 4 or 5 walking sims, but this one has the best story.

The voice acting is good. The music enhances the suspense of the story.

The only negative I can point out is the typos in the ingame journal entries. There are a lot. That's annoying since I'm used to proofreading because of my work.

It took me 3.5 hours to complete since I went for all the diary entries. I bought it on sale for 90% off. But I think it is worth the full price.
 
Karthik
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
1.8 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 12 aout 2018
This game! Treat yourself, buy it!

It's not very long. Taking my time, I'm approaching 2 hours. But the story worths it. In fact, the plot twist reminds me alot of The Vanishing of Ethan Carter. However, only close to the very end, I could guess what would happen. The rest of the time, I was imagining something completely different. So the least I can say is that I'm not disapointed at all by the ending.

The graphics, voices and audio are overall very nice. It's not really hard to figure out what to do but there are just enough things to make your brain work on to not feel the game is just linear and boring. The whole game is about the story more than anything else so take time to listen to the journal, etc. Everything is voiced so it's not like if it was a task to go through it.

Only sad thing about this game: not available in any other language than english. It's such a waste for all those who don't speak english. They'll never have a chance to enjoy this short but very awesome little story.

This is a very visual and atmospheric game, short, not too complex, but well worth the price. It's fairly quick, about 2 hours or so give or take. Just have to stay warm, my only advice!

I also found the voice acting a soundtrack to be very good, suprisingly good for an indie game. I would definitely buy more games from this studio in the future.

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Non recommandé
2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 30 juillet 2018
I just want to start by saying the primary reason I do not recommend this game is that the base price is $10. Generally I would say that is an acceptable price, but I feel a little shaky about that price for this particular title. There are two realy reasons for this. The first is that the game is only 2 hours long. That alone is fine if the game itself was an amazing experience. Unfortunately, there is little to no actual gameplay here, as one may expect, but I find that to be a problem. The 'Puzzles' basically require you to walk a linear path and turn magical valves which solve every single problem for you, somehow, in ways that make little to no sense. Even all this would be fine is the game had and excellent story as well. Unfortunately, the story here is not only predictable, but it leaves so many loose ends and makes so little sense in the end that it feels really sloppy; touching and told through pretty nice voice acting, but sloppy. Overall the game is decent, though, if this sort of game is one you like. However, I can't recommend this game at the full price, the experience simply isn't worth $10.
 
Reeze The Vampire
509 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.4 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 20 juillet 2018
Awsome game, very moving and emotional story. Id reccomend this, The graphics alone are jaw dropping in many areas, and the story never lets you feel bored. Great pacing, I wish it was longer, i feel so dead inside having finished this.

The only complaint i could see anyone have is during 3 parts, my fps went from being stable to under 10fps, right after the plane crash at the start for example i thought i'd have to lower my settings but after a few seconds it was stable above 60 fps ultra for atleast an hour until another big area change. Bassically whenever walking to another significant area you can expect harsh fps drops but just take them as load screens, it did only happen like 3 times though, but it was so harsh i obviously remember each one, and got scared something was wrong or the game was gonna crash. With that in mind id rate this game 10/10

Évaluation publiée le 14 juillet 2018
I really enjoyed this game.
Some of the reviews mention the Irish accents being over the top or hard to understand. If you've watched enough media with that accent or know anyone Irish? It's fine.
If you've even heard peripherally about Irish history in the last hundred years the back story isn't hard to grasp, you don't need to be Irish to play this game. Just have some basic empathy and an interest in the story!
The only thing that truly bothered me is that the ending could've been a tad more satisfying. However, I love a *completely* happy ending so that could just be me.
Overall I high recommend the game because it was interesting and challenging to complete. I felt like I was Stanley.

JJZPGG
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 11 juillet 2018
To get a simple review out, the game is short but I definitely enjoyed my time with the game.
  • The story seems a little strange at first, but felt rewarding when I was finished and it won't leave you hanging at the end. Maybe a little slow at the start, it does get a lot more compelling the deeper you go. On top of that, if you missed any of the story collectables by the end, it unlocks them all for you to read so no need to fear missing anything.
  • Overall graphics settings are mininal other than basic quality controls, but the game itself looks fine and doesn't pull any real complaints from me. I was getting a few graphical gliches, it seemed to be fixed by just reseting the game.
  • The atmosphere is very good and nothing really broke immersion, even if it's not running off full realism.
  • Music is really nice and you get the soundtrack for free. Something to keep in mind if you're thinking about getting it.
  • 10$ (US) may be a little pricy for this. If you're on a budget, I'd wait for a sale at least 50%+ but anything 75%+ should be gotten, as you'll get worth out of it for that price.
Overall, a good game and if you're into the story-driven walking simulators with the simple puzzels thrown in, you'll probably enjoy the game.

Son of a submariner
659 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation amusante
0
Recommandé
2.3 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 6 juillet 2018
In short
This is an average walking sim, there's so much to love, but a bit to hate on my end, overall though, the story was interesting, and i played to the end, and for 99 cents, it was totally worth.

Things i love
The graphics are amazing especially considering the size of the team, not to mention the way the enviornment very successfully leads you through it without much need for narration. Though the use of campfires and smoke isn't very interesting, it really does a great job leading you objective to objective.
And most importantly, there was only one bug that i found, where i got stuck between a rock and a pipe, and that only happened because i'm an idiot.

Things i hate
Starting off with what i hated most, and that was how the beautiful enviornment will go underappreciated because the player will spend an assload of time getting lost, but instead of admiring the graphics, they'll be stumbling to find the nearest campfire or gyser so they don't freeze to death.
I'm not entirely against the mechanic, but how fast you freeze to death is unreasonable, and personally i see it as a game design oversight.
There was a part in the game where no matter which campfire i started at, i could not reach a necessary part of the game without freezing to death. I looked for ways around it, and eventually watched a walkthrough, where they went from one campfire to the site on their first try, i try this for 30 mintues, and accomplish nothing. My resolution - download cheatengine and speed myself up enough to get there before dying - this worked, but i shouldn't have had to resort to that.

Here's a clump of more minor things that still grineded my gears
There is no player control over using your flashlight, there's no explanation or justification as to how Leonore knew the code to the door early on (and although i like the ending, i don't think it should be used as an excuse for that), and the only first person animation or indication that you're playing as a being is while ice climbing.

Conclusion
Some people might not care about this, or might not expect it, or might super disagree with it, but personally i didn't get any gratification at any point while playing this game. There were no "Wow!" or "HELL YEAH!" moments, there was nothing that makes me think this game is better than just good. The one reason i finished the game was to see how the story wrapped up, which i think is definitely enough to justify buying this game on sale. Overall it was a great length, an interesting and somewhat original plot, and a decent ending.
 
Dnompal ꐕ
481 produits enregistrés
0
1 personne a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 4 juillet 2018
This was a very short 2 hour game (3 if you stop to take in all the scenery), and it's worth the $10.

It's a heavily story based walking simulator, and one of the best ones out there. Your plane crashes on an island off the coast of Iceland and you, Stanley, have to rescue your wife Leonore. You communicate with her via walkie-talkie, and come to learn she has been injured, as her leg is stuck under a piece of the plane. (You learn this within 5 minutes, so very light spoiler?)

Leonore also has a journal consisting of 30 pages that have been scattered around the island that play beautifully into the story telling. I myself collected 29 of the 30, so I had to look the last one up online! They can be a bit tricky to find so you really have to keep an eye out. All of the journals are voiced over and are wonderfully done. You'll definitely want to collect them all.

The voice acting is incredible, the story is very intriguing, the graphics/art style left me in awe, and the soundtrack was so undeniably outstanding and set the tone perfectly! And it's a free download!

This game felt like Firewatch meets Dear Esther. That's the best way I can describe it. If you liked either of those games, then you will absolutely love this one!

But if you do not like walking sims then stay away, as this game has nothing for you here!

As for the rest of you, kick back, and enjoy 2-3 hours of bliss!
 
N4SWS

1.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 25 juin 2018
I played it, i loved it. I feel morose after, the story kept me wanting to go despite it being simply a walking simulator.

Only buy this game on sale, to be honest no it isn't worth full price. Not even half, not because the game is bad, but because it is only 1.6 hours long sprinting and reading everything.

Summary:
The gameplay is running and walking with the occasional E press.
It kept me wondering what happened until the end,
the puzzles wern't too long and I didn't get board of doing them.
The music was pleasent and the free soundtrack is just icing on the cake.
This game made me feel empathy for a man who has delt with nightmares of his past.
The voice acting is great, and the graphics are pretty stock unreal graphics so nothing to argue there.

Do I regret buying it? No
Will I go back through it and try to get the last achievement? No

Story - 4.8 / 5
Music - 4.5 / 5
Gameplay - 2 / 5
Graphics - 4 / 5
Overall - 8 / 10

Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile

Recommandé
1.5 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 23 avril 2018
Heavy usage of vignette, motion blur, chromatic aberration and effects in general may sometimes feel overwhelming but graphics are pretty good. Voice acting is great. Story is pretty decent. Has some game mechanics outside of the walking sim stuff so thats appreciated. Can be finished around 90 minutes. Its really cheap and totally worth the price.
On a side note, footsteps of the character was little off putting for me. It rather feels like the left footstep is coming from left-back diagonal and the right footstep is coming from right-back diagonal instead of it actually coming from the character's feet, therefore the center. I mean feet are at most 50 cm apart from each other when walking so that much seperation in audio is unnecessary and unrealistic.

2.0 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 21 avril 2018
All the elements are here but they're slighly off.
The story was engaging however by the end, the people that were in it didnt feel 100% relatable. Mostly due of the bizarre choice in character backstory. Voice acting is okay, lines are delivered with emotion but the choice of dialogue throws it off. The pace starts off slow and then picks up. Puzzles arent hard at all but that keeps the pace quick. This all sounds negative but I'd still play it again. It gets deliciously dark and does a great job at making you feel like you're in a kind of psychosis. If you can pick this up few bucks, its worth a play through.

Recommandé
3.1 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 2 juin 2018
Let me start of with saying that I really like this games story. And many problems I encountered weren't mentioned by the majority of the reviews which is why I still recommend it. It is very much a story game with not too much interaction other than clicking on things here and there and sometimes swimming. If you're into that (and the setting in Iceland and the backstory of the characters) - this is a game you probably will like.
Problems:
BUT I encountered a few bugs while playing this and couldn't even finish it. Sometimes I had to hold the left mousebutton down so my character would even turn his head (yes, that took me a while to figure that out). From now on I will mention things that could be seen as Spoilers (I'm not gonna talk about the story though) so SPOILER WARNING!
--- Falling into the water - while being a nice touch to the game - is so disorienting and makes it frustrating to find a piece of land to get out (especially when your character refuses to turn his head) but I can accept it. In the one dream sequence everything was pretty much black for me and it was a real struggle to get through it. With the help of Playthroughs on YouTube I was able to navigate through though. Really took me out of the game though. And, like I already wrote in the beginning, I couldn't even finish the game because the screen stayed white when Stanley was in a bit of a pickle. So in this sense I don't recommend it but since the majority of the players don't seem to have encountered these problems I still give a thumbs up.

This game, although frustrating at times, is overall worth the couple of bucks on sale and couple of hours to complete. Overall, I would recommend this to the person looking for a short indie that's a little bit harrowing and a little bit thought-provoking. (for the scaredy cats out there: not a scary game)

Évaluation publiée le 11 avril 2018
The Fidelio Incident is a 2 hour journey through the mountains of Iceland, through the rubble of the plane crash, and through the memories of Stanley and Leonore. The gameplay is fun and the story is engaging. Treat it like a light snack and you'll enjoy it, but if you expect a main course you'll probably be left hungry. 7/10
 
Jornam
320 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 22 mars 2018
A pure blood Walking Simulator, although some might argue not the best one, it has all ingredients present for a good game in the genre:

- A good story & intriguing metaphor
- Some interactivity & puzzles
- Great presentation both visually and auditory

How much you enjoy the story and the game depends largely on how you connect with the game world. It has to be noted that the larger part of the story comes from collectible diary pages, however they are fully voiced and of good quality. If you do not interact with them the game might feel lacking.

Walking Simulators have never been for the mainstream audience who need bombastic action to sustain enthousiasm (at least the newer generations). But the only issue I had with the game is that the diary cannot be collected chronologically and therefor seems a bit chaotic at first. Soon however the plot starts to unwind and it all makes sense in due time, it is interesting to listen to the full audio diary once you have (collected and) completed the game.
 
Nosferatu
442 produits enregistrés
0
Personne n'a trouvé cette évaluation utile
0
Recommandé
5.6 h en tout
Évaluation publiée le 5 mars 2018
This one wouldn't be a bad game if it could keep up the performance. The game has stucked sometimes for a second or two, but nothing serious. The bigger issue is with the control. I played with X360 controller and it wasn't so fluid and handy. A map would may be useful sometime, and the graphics is okay, but I missed the customization. I would really liked to turn off the film effect, but that's all. Aside these, this is a decent game, the story is okay, the voice acting is great, the sound design (especially in the ice cave) is great. If you can get over the technical issues what I mentioned (which is not terrible, just bugged me), you can enjoy the narrative part of the game.
